column7: Advanced skills in and understanding of asset pricing, equity and debt investment, portfolio theory and diversification, asset allocation, financial risk management, and financial intermediation and regulation emphasizing applications in financial planning and agricultural finance. 3 undergraduate hours. 3 or 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: One of ACE 240, ACE 345, or FIN 221 or consent of instructor.
column9: 3 undergraduate hours. 3 or 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: One of ACE 240, ACE 345, or FIN 221 or consent of instructor.
